title: 'Reached a deal...': Trump announces 15% tariffs on EU; calls it 'good deal for everybody'
content: Donald Trump and Ursula von der Leyen announced a trade deal between the US and EU, aiming to resolve a prolonged transatlantic trade dispute. Trump and Ursula von der Leyen met in Scotland for crucial discussions, seeking to resolve the prolonged transatlantic trade dispute, with negotiations reaching their final stages.

title: 'I settled India-Pak, now it's Thailand-Cambodia'; Trump credits trade pressure, calls it 'honour'
content: Donald Trump claimed on Sunday that he intervened to settle the India-Pakistan ceasefire, reiterating a past assertion while discussing conflict between Thailand and Cambodia. He stated he warned the prime ministers of Thailand and Cambodia that trade deals hinged on ceasing hostilities. Trump suggested his intervention prevented a potential conflict between India and Pakistan.

title: Gill, Jadeja, Washington seal gritty draw for India
content: India pulled off a gritty draw at Old Trafford, with centuries from Ravindra Jadeja and Washington Sundar sealing a remarkable escape. After being 0/2, India lost just two wickets in 143 overs, frustrating England. Shubman Gill’s century, KL Rahul’s resilience, and a determined middle-order kept India alive in the series heading into the finale at The Oval.

title: CRPF personnel made a mark by their duty, courage, says PM on Raising Day
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi lauded the CRPF's crucial role in national security, particularly in internal security challenges, on the force's 87th Raising Day. Home Minister Amit Shah commended the CRPF's selfless sacrifice and courage in combating Naxalism. Home Secretary Govind Mohan assured the CRPF of the Home Ministry's commitment to providing modern weapons and technology to address increasing security threats.

title: Srinagar a paradise, I feel at home here, says CJI
content: Chief Justice of India B R Gavai, during his first visit to Srinagar post Article 370 abrogation, remarked on the region's beauty, quoting a Persian couplet. Speaking at a NALSA conference, he emphasized justice for all citizens and urged the J&K and Ladakh High Court to consider a separate bench for Ladakh UT, addressing the Ladakh Bar's request.

title: Jeff Bezos sells $1.5 billion worth of Amazon shares, now holds stock valued at…
content: Jeff Bezos recently sold 6.6 million Amazon shares worth $1.5 billion, as per an SEC filing. The sales occurred on July 21 and 22, before Amazon's Q2 earnings report. These transactions were executed under a prearranged 10b5-1 trading plan. Bezos intends to sell more shares, potentially up to 25 million by May 2026. He has already sold $4.

title: TCS layoffs: What will the IT firm do for 12,000 employees being laid off?
content: Tata Consultancy Services plans to reduce its workforce by approximately 2%, impacting over 12,000 employees due to economic uncertainties and AI-driven technological changes. The company will provide affected staff with notice period compensation, severance benefits, insurance coverage, and outplacement assistance. This decision comes amid a slowdown in hiring across the Indian software services sector.

title: Mark Zuckerberg appoints ChatGPT co-creator Shengjia Zhao as chief scientist for Meta's AI lab
content: Mark Zuckerberg has announced Shengjia Zhao as the chief scientist of Meta Superintelligence Labs. Zhao co-created ChatGPT. He also played a key role in developing GPT-4. Meta has invested heavily in AI talent acquisition. The company has hired talents from Google, OpenAI, Apple and Anthropic. Meta will also spend billions on AI data centers in the US.

title: Did Epstein introduce Melania to Trump? Biographer makes bold claim
content: Michael Wolff has stirred controversy by alleging Jeffrey Epstein played a role in introducing Melania Trump to Donald Trump. Wolff claims Melania was involved in Epstein's social circle and connected through Paolo Zampolli. Melania denies this, saying she met Trump at the Kit Kat Klub. Despite Trump's attempts to distance himself, photos and Epstein's claims suggest otherwise.

title: PDP reasserts self-rule demand, fields Irtiqa in key role on foundation day
content: PDP reaffirmed its commitment to self-rule in J&K, advocating for cross-border trade and eased travel with PoK, aiming for a dignified resolution to political conflicts. Irtiqa Mufti, daughter of PDP President Mehbooba Mufti, delivered the message, emphasizing the party's founding principles of dignity, dialogue, and democratic rights for the people of J&K.

title: Over a million Americans data 'hacked': Allianz Life says majority of customers’ data stolen; FBI notified
content: Allianz Life Insurance Company of North America faced a significant hacking incident. Hackers accessed a third-party system. They obtained personal data of many customers, financial professionals, and some employees. The company is investigating and has notified the FBI. Allianz Life is offering identity theft protection. The breach only affected Allianz Life in the US.

title: US & China may extend tariff pause by another 3 months, says report
content: The US and China are likely to extend their tariff truce for another 90 days as trade negotiations continue, with discussions planned in Stockholm on Monday. During this period, both countries will refrain from new tariffs.

title: IND vs ENG: Stokes reacts after India batters decline handshake, draw offered
content: England's captain, Ben Stokes, offered a draw in the fourth Test, aiming to conserve his bowlers for an upcoming match due to fatigue. India declined, as Ravindra Jadeja and Washington Sundar were approaching personal milestones. Jadeja later completed his century, and India's captain defended the decision, highlighting the importance of individual achievements.

title: How to get permanent residency in Qatar in 2025?
content: Qatar's Permanent Residency program, established in 2018, offers long-term residence to eligible expats who meet specific criteria, including extended residency, Arabic proficiency, and financial stability. The program grants access to public services, business ownership, and property rights, attracting skilled professionals and investors. A limited number of permits are issued annually, ensuring a strategic approach to retaining talent.

title: Hulk Hogan’s death linked to hectic schedule after surgery
content: Hulk Hogan, the wrestling icon, passed away at 71 due to cardiac arrest, exacerbated by a demanding travel schedule following multiple surgeries. Despite doctors' recommendations for rest, Hogan continued promoting his businesses and attending events nationwide. His friend Bubba suggests this relentless pace contributed to fatal health complications, while fans speculate about a potential state funeral honoring Hogan's legacy.

title: Caroline Wozniacki and David Lee welcome third child
content: Caroline Wozniacki and David Lee welcomed their third child, Max Wozniacki Lee, on July 26th. The tennis star shared a heartwarming photo of her older children, Olivia and James, cradling their new baby brother. Wozniacki hinted at the pregnancy earlier this year and her tennis future remains uncertain as she focuses on her growing family.

title: Tom Lehrer dies at 97: Satirical singer found dead at home; famed for taboo-breaking songs
content: American satirist Tom Lehrer passed away at 97. He was famous for his darkly comic songs. Lehrer gained recognition in the 1950s and 60s. He was also a mathematician who taught at prestigious universities. His satirical songs tackled war, drug use, and religion. Lehrer's work remained popular through radio and stage shows. He never married and had no children.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Ben Stokes behaved like a spoiled kid' - Ex-India cricketer
content: Sanjay Manjrekar criticized Ben Stokes for his conduct in offering a draw before the final hour, labeling it as behaving like a 'spoiled kid.' Jonathan Trott defended Stokes, citing common practice in England, but Manjrekar countered that the world doesn't play cricket the 'English way.

title: What is Golf Force One? Trump's armoured buggy patrols Scottish golf course
content: Donald Trump visited his golf course in South Ayrshire, Scotland. Security was tight, including an armored golf cart. Protests occurred in Edinburgh and other UK cities during the visit. Demonstrators voiced opposition to Trump's politics. One protester breached security at the golf course. Trump played golf with his son Eric and ambassador Warren Stephens despite the demonstrations.

title: Russia starts direct flight from Moscow to North Korea's Pyongyang
content: Russia has initiated direct commercial flights between Moscow and Pyongyang, marking a significant step in strengthening ties with North Korea. The inaugural Nordwind Airlines flight departed Moscow on Sunday, with plans for monthly service.

title: IND vs ENG: Stokes trolled after India reject draw offer; memes break internet
content: During the fourth Test between India and England, Ben Stokes's offer to draw the match was declined by Ravindra Jadeja and Washington Sundar, who were both approaching centuries. This unexpected refusal sparked humorous reactions online, with fans creating memes and jokes about Stokes' bewildered response. Jadeja then completed his century, adding to the drama of the match.

title: Udaipur Files producer gets CRPF Y-category security; had alleged threats to his life
content: The central government has granted 'Y' category CRPF security to Amit Jani, producer of "Udaipur Files," following alleged death threats. Jani, who heads Uttar Pradesh Navnirman Sena, expressed gratitude to PM Modi and Home Minister Shah.

title: Laughter Chefs' season 2 winner: Karan Kundrra and Elvish Yadav lift the trophy
content: Laughter Chefs Season 2 concluded with Karan Kundrra and Elvish Yadav emerging as winners, decided by audience votes. The season was filled with unexpected twists, comedic moments from Krushna Abhishek and Sudesh Lehri, and heartwarming connections. Celebrities like Aly Goni, Nia Sharma, and Rubina Dilaik added to the entertainment, making it a memorable journey for both participants and viewers.

title: ENG vs IND: Nasser Hussain slams Ben Stokes - 'It looked silly'
content: Nasser Hussain criticized Ben Stokes for his "silly" reaction after Stokes seemingly protested India's refusal to accept a draw in the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy match. Stokes' frustration led him to give Harry Brook the ball, which Jadeja then hit for a six to reach his century.

title: Israel's defence minister warns 'dictator' Khamenei; asks him not to threaten Israel
content: Israeli Defence Minister Israel Katz issued a stark warning to Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, threatening direct retaliation if threats against Israel persist. Katz lauded the Israeli Air Force's role in Operation Rising Lion, which targeted Iranian nuclear and military infrastructure.

title: IND vs ENG: Stokes offers handshake to draw; but India say no - what really happened?
content: During the fourth Test at Old Trafford, England captain Ben Stokes offered a handshake to signal a draw, but Indian batters Ravindra Jadeja and Washington Sundar declined, surprising Stokes. Both were approaching centuries, and India, in a dominant position, chose to continue batting. Stokes's reaction showed frustration as the game continued, highlighting India's assertive play and focus on personal milestones.

title: Donald Trump and EU chief begin trade deal talks in Scotland; seen as make-or-break
content: In Scotland, US President Donald Trump and EU chief Ursula von der Leyen are engaging in trade deal talks to resolve a prolonged transatlantic dispute. Trump had earlier indicated a 50% chance of reaching an agreement before the August 1 deadline, with a 30% reciprocal tariff looming.

title: 'World understands power': Bhagwat on why India must be 'strong and wealthy'
content: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat emphasized India's need to become powerful and economically strong to gain global respect, advocating for the preservation of national identity by using "Bharat" without translation. He highlighted that true education should promote sacrifice and societal contribution, extending beyond schooling to encompass the home and community environment. Bhagwat urged focus on raising responsible future generations.

title: IND vs ENG: Not even Kohli! Jadeja reaches historic milestone during 4th Test
content: Ravindra Jadeja's impressive batting performances in England continue to defy expectations, surpassing the records of Indian batting legends like Virat Kohli and VVS Laxman. His crucial half-century at Old Trafford and unbeaten partnership with Washington Sundar helped India recover from a shaky start. Jadeja's resilience and record-breaking feats solidify his status as a complete cricketer in challenging English conditions.

title: Uddhav-Raj bonhomie: Inside Thackeray political reset - desperate photo-op or strategic comeback?
content: The Thackeray cousins, Uddhav and Raj, are exploring a reunion amidst shifting political dynamics in Maharashtra, particularly with the upcoming BMC elections. Both leaders, facing challenges to their political relevance, aim to consolidate their support base. This alliance could reshape the political landscape, especially with a weakened Shinde faction and potential realignments within the NDA.

title: IND vs PAK: Ex-India skipper Ganguly on playing Pakistan in Asia Cup - 'Sport must go on'
content: Asia Cup 2025 faces political tensions after a terrorist attack in Pahalgam, even as India and Pakistan are set to clash in the tournament. Sourav Ganguly advocates for sports to continue while condemning terrorism. The tournament, featuring eight teams in the T20 format, is scheduled in UAE and will act as preparation for the upcoming T20 World Cup.

title: Who is Trisha Chatterjee? Indian-origin lawyer says ICE gave Taco Bell number during crisis — video
content: Trisha Chatterjee, an Ohio immigration lawyer, claims an ICE officer gave her a Taco Bell number instead of assistance with urgent client cases, sparking controversy. After her TikTok video went viral, another ICE official offered help. Chatterjee highlights the broader issue of poor ICE communication, impacting immigrants facing detention and difficult bond policies, leading some to abandon their asylum claims.

title: Will the August 1 deadline be extended by Trump? What Commerce Secretary said
content: US Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick announced that President Trump's reciprocal tariff deadline of August 1, 2025, will not be extended. These tariffs will be implemented, with Customs beginning to collect revenue.

title: Gabrielle Union on Kaavia: Daughter obsessed with marriage; Wade family vacation vibes
content: Gabrielle Union shared a humorous anecdote about her daughter Kaavia's obsession with marriage during a family vacation in Hawaii. Kaavia, enamored with her best friend Crosby, declared him her husband without his knowledge, leading to comical and awkward situations throughout the trip. Union highlighted Kaavia's bold personality and the family's tradition of escaping to Hawaii for Christmas.

title: Chess | Women's WC final: Humpy, Divya head to tie-break after Game 2 draw
content: The FIDE Women's World Cup 2025 final between GM Koneru Humpy and IM Divya Deshmukh remains undecided after a second draw in their classical match in Batumi. The tense encounter saw a cautious game, leading to a repetition of moves and a stalemate. The title will now be determined in Monday's rapid tie-breaks, pitting Humpy's experience against Divya's youthful talent.

title: Neena Gupta once recalled Vivian Richards’ reaction to her pregnancy
content: Neena Gupta, currently enjoying a career high, has always been candid about her life, including her relationship with Vivian Richards. She revealed his supportive response when she informed him about her pregnancy, despite societal disapproval of single motherhood at the time. Neena also shared her unique perspective on love, emphasizing the profound bond she shares with her daughter, Masaba.

title: 'Matter of happiness': Fadnavis says 'nothing political' in Raj's Matoshree visit
content: Devendra Fadnavis downplayed any political implications of Raj Thackeray's visit to Uddhav Thackeray's residence, Matoshree, for his birthday, emphasising it as a gesture of goodwill. However, the meeting, following their joint opposition to Hindi as a medium of instruction, fuels speculation of a potential MNS-Shiv Sena (UBT) alliance for the upcoming local body elections.

title: One hour of Stokes in Manchester: One shoulder, one spell, one statement
content: Ben Stokes delivered a stirring eight-over spell on Day 5 at Old Trafford, breaking a key Indian partnership and pushing through visible pain. With his shoulder aching and hamstring tight, Stokes's relentless intensity and tactical brilliance kept England in the game, reaffirming his reputation as one of the sport’s ultimate warriors.

title: Rodgers on Bradshaw barbs: He doesn't know me
content: Aaron Rodgers said he'd like to get to know Terry Bradshaw on "a deeper level" after the Steelers legend ripped his former team's pursuit of the future Hall of Fame quarterback.

title: Proper English: Lionesses beat Spain, win Euro
content: England beat Spain 3-1 in a penlty shootout to win Euro 2025 on Sunday, successfully defending the title they won in 2022 after an enthralling encounter.

title: Sources: Bolts reach record deal with LT Slater
content: The Chargers and Rashawn Slater reached agreement on a four-year, $114 million contract extension that includes a record $92 million guaranteed that makes him the highest-paid offensive lineman in NFL history, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Sources: Bulls' Donovan gets multiyear extension
content: Chicago Bulls coach Billy Donovan has signed a multiyear contract extension with the franchise, sources told ESPN on Sunday.

title: Judge to DH upon return; 1B not among options
content: The Yankees are not considering having Aaron Judge play first base when he returns from the IL, a source told ESPN. He will be slotted at DH until he can play in the outfield.

title: Dolphins, Fitzpatrick agree to reworked contract
content: The Dolphins have agreed to a reworked contract with safety Minkah Fitzpatrick, which adds a $16.435 million signing bonus, a source told Adam Schefter on Sunday.

title: Easy rider: Pogačar wins 4th Tour de France title
content: Tadej Pogačar won his fourth Tour de France title by a comfortable margin ahead of two-time champ Jonas Vingegaard and Florian Lipowitz.

title: Falcons skirmishes ruffle feathers, go 'little too far'
content: The Atlanta Falcons' offensive and defensive units got into several skirmishes Sunday during practice, including two involving rookie edge rusher James Pearce Jr.

title: 🏈 Iconic alternate CFB uniforms of past 25 years
content: We handed out nominations to some of the best, worst and wildest alternate uniforms donned by college football teams over the past quarter century.

title: England's Euro 2025 win defies logic; Spain curse continues
content: England were ahead in the Euro 2025 knockouts for just four minutes and 52 seconds. But they beat Spain on penalties to defend their crown.

title: 'Everybody just died laughing': Teammates, opponents on what makes Ichiro a Hall of Fame icon
content: As a Mariners icon gets his Cooperstown call, teammates and opponents share what makes him 100% Hall of Fame worthy.

title: MLB trade deadline updates, rumors: Bubble teams could shape week ahead
content: Which contenders will make the biggest splash? Here's what we're hearing as 6 p.m. ET on July 31 approaches.

title: UFC Abu Dhabi takeaways: Why Whittaker's loss is good for the middleweight division
content: What does Reinier de Ridder's win mean for the middleweight division? Brett Okamoto provides takeaways.

title: Cameo guide: PGA stars, NFL champ, WWE icons and more
content: Nearly 30 years after the original, "Happy Gilmore 2" brings a who's who of stars from the PGA, NFL, NBA, WWE and more.

title: Return to your happy place: How Happy Gilmore's long-awaited sequel came to be
content: "Happy Gilmore 2" tees off 29 years later with sports stars, and a mission to honor the cult classic's legacy.

title: Ibrahimovic, Messi, Gerrard: The 10 best and 10 worst DPs in MLS history
content: With the MLS transfer window opening Thursday, ESPN looks back at some of the best and worst big-money signings in league history.

title: SEC preview: Alabama, Georgia, Texas, LSU ... this conference is wide open
content: The SEC never lacks for talent or storylines -- and there's no reason to think 2025 will be any different.

title: Can Florida repeat? How good will BYU be? Our men's hoops preview 100 days out
content: The Gators bolstered their roster, while the Cougars welcomed the top recruit. Here are 98 more things to know.

title: All-SEC Final Four? 100 predictions, more at 100 days until women's hoops
content: From the biggest storylines to the top players to watch, we preview the 2025-26 women's basketball season.

title: Who are the best NFL draft prospects for next year? Debating the No. 1 player at 11 positions
content: Who is the top quarterback, edge rusher and corner in the 2026 NFL draft class? We debated every position's early lead.

title: Woad, 21, wins Scottish Open in debut as pro
content: Two weeks ago, Lottie Woad was the world's No. 1 amateur. On Sunday, the 21-year-old Englishwoman became an LPGA Tour champion in her professional debut.

title: NBA summer storylines we're still watching, including the Kuminga saga at Golden State
content: The NBA's offseason flurry is winding down, but key restricted free agent and superstar extension decisions are still looming.

title: Reactions to MLB trade deadline deals
content: Track the fantasy fallout from all the key deals as we head towards the MLB trade deadline on Thursday, July 31.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool among clubs eyeing young striker Idrissa Gueye
content: Liverpool are among a host of clubs who have enquired about young Senegal striker Idrissa Gueye. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Mock draft: Five QBs go in first round of 10-team superflex
content: The top signal-callers went early and quality wide receivers remained available in the middle rounds.

title: Ohio to Virginia: SportsCenter's 50-in-50 Week 5 quiz
content: Did someone say sports trivia? As "SportsCenter" continues its summer road trip, we're back for our fifth "state check."

title: Jammu ‘shoot-out’: J&K Police take suspended policemen to crime site, seize service rifle, victim’s bike
content: Officials said the SIT, headed by a Deputy Superintendent of Police-rank officer, visited the site in Satwari where the incident took place on July 24

title: Mamata launches ‘language movement’, condemns targeting of migrant’s family in Delhi
content: Migrants from West Bengal have been detained in different states like Odisha, Haryana and Delhi on suspicion of being Bangladeshi nationals.

title: Clearing the air on ‘citizenship’ in Bihar poll roll revision
content: The political objections being raised on the issue of citizenship reveal a lack of knowledge of the Constitution, legislation and the working of the electoral system

title: Bihar SIR: 91.69% have submitted enumeration forms, says Election Commission of India
content: Of the 7.89 crore registered electors as on June 24, over 7.24 crore had submitted enumeration forms indicating overwhelming participation, the poll body says

title: Senior Living Conclave 2025 held in Chennai
content: The conclave emphaised the importance of design and healthcare features such as anti-skid flooring, emergency response systems and access to on-call doctors in making homes safer for seniors

title: Detainees being released, but crackdown on ‘illegal immigrants’ continues in Gurugram
content: The drive has drawn widespread criticism over the alleged harassment of detainees and targeting of Bengali-speaking migrant workers from Assam and West Bengal

title: RESA extension work at Calicut airport in progress
content: Though the project is scheduled to be completed by March next year, the construction company has sought an extension of three months because of the delay caused by the rain

title: New Zealand kayakers steal the show at 11th edition of Malabar River Festival finale
content: Among the Indian kayakers, Arjun Singh Rawat secured the top position, followed by Amar Singh Ankit and Kuldeep Singh in second and third place, respectively

title: Surbana Jurong and Eversendai show interest to invest in Andhra Pradesh
content: Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu invites Surbana Jurong to play a pivotal role in the State’s ‘Housing for All’ initiative; Eversendai Engineering proposes establishment of a state-of-the-art manufacturing facility and an integrated training center

title: Digital recreation of Portuguese Fort at Chaliyam in final stages
content: The fort was built at the mouth of Beypore river around 1530, reportedly with the support of local chieftains opposed to Calicut kingdom. It was constructed at a strategic location to corner Zamorin

title: Cong., IUML express concern over draft voters’ list
content: Kozhikode DCC to approach HC over alleged discrepancies in the draft voters’ list for local body polls; names of a large number of voters missing in list, says Local Government Members’ League

title: Mallikarjun Kharge recalls how he missed a chance to becoming Chief Minister
content: The AICC president becomes emotional while participating in a function organised in memory of the founders of BLDE Society in Vijayapura

title: Dams continue to release water, flood alert for Bhavani basin
content: Several houses in Chittur taluk were flooded following accumulation of trees at Thiruvazhiyode bridge. Road traffic was affected following uprooting of trees at different parts. District officials said that two dozen houses were damaged in the rain since Saturday

title: CAPF personnel injured during operations will get full benefits till retirement: Union Home Secretary
content: Govind Mohan said the government will ensure the best medical facilities and technology available in the world for ‘limb replacement surgery’ for CAPF officials and jawans and it will be ensured that loss of limbs is corrected as far as possible

title: 'Not found suitable' clause weaponised against SCs, STs, OBCs to deny them job opportunities: Congress
content: Rahul Gandhi also attacked the Modi government over vacant reserved posts for SCs, STs, and OBCs in central universities and said this is not just negligence but a "well-planned conspiracy" to keep "bahujans" out of education, research and policies.

title: NCB, police in Rajasthan and Maharashtra bust inter-State synthetic drug syndicate
content: Clandestine labs uncovered in Barmer and Raigad; precursors and equipment seized, investigation underway

title: Stop SIR in Bihar, refrain from ‘institutional arrogance’, says INDIA bloc
content: Stating that the SIR had become a process of establishing citizenship, Congress leader Abhishek Manu Singhvi asked if the Election Commission was authorised to do so

title: Six BJP workers injured in alleged TIPRA Motha attack in Tripura
content: Clashes occurred during PM’s Mann Ki Baat broadcast in Khowai district; Forest Minister denies party role

title: Critical vulnerability exposed sensitive data of voluntary organ donors
content: After security researcher’s alert, Computer Emergency Response Team plugged the gap in AIIMS portal; in an email to CERT, the researcher had flagged that the vulnerability disclosed personally identifiable and medical information of donors

title: The return of the native
content: After over a decade of wandering and uncertainty, the Kodarvi tribe returned to their village this July following a truce with the Dabhi tribe that had pushed them out of their lands in a tradition called chadotaru. Abhinay Deshpande reports from Gujarat’s Banaskantha district on how the police played a role in the agreement between communities and the rebuilding of their lives

title: A section of Congress leaders rally in support of Satheesan against Vellappally’s attacks
content: K.C. Joseph says criticism of any political leader should conform to accepted standards of public decency. LDF government was prompt in arresting a person for criticising VS, but was reticent in prosecuting Vellappally for ‘spewing communal venom,’ says SYS leader

title: MEA ‘nearly lost the plot’ on Indus Treaty negotiations, says former Finance Secretary Subhash Garg
content: In his new book, No, Minister: Navigating Power, Politics and Bureaucracy with a Steely Resolve, Garg says he was sidelined during the initial stages of the Indus Water Treaty negotiations in 2016

title: TNCC pins its hope on efforts to create “an army” of full-time workers like RSS
content: Since December last year, the party has tried to constitute “verified” committees under the supervision of senior leader Peter Alphonse. The credentials of the committee members are vetted before they are given identity cards. These members will take the party’s ideology and policies directly to the voters

title: Teacher unions oppose ‘forced registration’ in P4 scheme, demand voluntary participation
content: PDF MLC and teacher unions slam pressure tactics by officials, say adoption of families under poverty eradication drive should be optional

title: Stark gap between guidance and market values of properties spurs Karnataka govt. to mull over revision
content: Market value is a whopping 10 times that of the guidance value or even more in several locations in districts abutting Bengaluru

title: MHA refuses to share data on CAA beneficiaries
content: Bengal MP demands relaxation in CAA rules and amendment to cut off-date;The Hindu had filed RTI applications in June 2024 and September 2024, but the MHA refused to provide the information

title: LDF, UDF condemn arrest of two Keralite nuns on ‘trumped-up’ charge of forced conversion in Chhattisgarh
content: Catholic Bishops Conference of India terms the arrest an infringement on the fundamental right to freedom of religion and unrestricted movement, and accuses Bajrang Dal activists of detaining the nuns with police’s connivance

title: Minister assures water to all irrigation projects in  Rayalaseema
content: For the first time in 25 years, we have released Krishna water into Srisailam in July. Similarly, plans are afoot to fill up Adavipalli reservoir with 3,850 cusecs of Krishna water through Handri Neeva canal, says Rama Naidu

title: Thrissur Rural police nab attempted murder accused from Gundlupet hideout
content: Acting on intelligence inputs, a special team tracked the accused to a secluded farmhouse in Shivapura, near Gundlupet, where they had been hiding for the past five days

title: Lokesh appeals to Telugu diaspora to invest in Andhra Pradesh and contribute to its growth
content: Participating in a meeting organised by the A.P. Non-Resident Telugu Society and A.P. Economic Development Board in Singapore, he promises necessary hand-holding to the Telugu entrepreneurs coming forward to partner with the government

title: PM’s visit set to boost tourism in Tiruchi region
content: Gangaikonda Cholapuram emerged as one of the top searched items online since the announcement was made about Prime Minister’s  visit to Brahadisvar Temple about two weeks ago

title: NMC guidelines on live broadcast of surgeries focus on patient welfare, ethical standards
content: Live broadcasts of surgeries should strictly serve educational purposes, and are not for commercial gain; surgeons should avoid glorification, and be responsible in adhering to professional and ethical standards, the guidelines state

title: TNSDMA, WRD issue alert along the banks of the Cauvery
content: In Tiruchi, washermen and other riverside residents have been directly warned and autorickshaws have been deployed to make announcements about the impending flood threat

title: Plea to shift Myanmar Kuki detainees from Imphal jail
content: The rights organisation seeks transfer of Myanmar nationals to prison facilities in Kuki-dominated districts within the State; urges release of detainees held beyond their sentence period

title: New cooperative policy centralises power and snatches rights of State governments, says Samyukt Kisan Morcha
content: The farmers’ umbrella body alleges that the policy favours takeover of agriculture sector by corporate sector

title: Ahmedabad police rescues 39 children found in vulnerable conditions
content: Officials say the drive focuses on identifying children at risk and ensuring their immediate protection and steps will be taken for the children’s rehabilitation

title: Rich tributes paid to martyrs to mark Kargil Vijay Divas
content: Mayor Jyoti Patil lays a wreath at the Kargil memorial located in front of the Deputy Commissioner’s office in Dharwad

title: State Horticulture Mission-Kerala to establish Mushroom villages in 50 more locations
content: The scheme, Comprehensive Development of Mushroom Villages in Kerala, is aimed at the empowerment of rural women, income generation for farmers, nutritional security and spotlighting business opportunities in mushroom cultivation

title: Andhra Pradesh government offers final chance for unapproved layout regularisation under amended LRS
content: Applications open for 90 days from July 26; only plots with registered deeds before June 30, 2025, eligible for regularisation

title: Tamil Nadu CM Stalin discharged after therapeutic procedure
content: Doctors have advised the Chief Minister to resume his normal routine after three days of rest post-discharge

title: Five arrested for murdering elderly woman, robbery in Chittapur
content: Investigation revealed that the accused made an attempt to manipulate the crime scene to make the murder appear as natural death

title: Narcotic drug manufacturing facility raided in Mysuru
content: Four persons arrested; raid carried out by the Maharashtra police in coordination with the Mysuru City police

title: New campaign to help higher education institutions in Kerala get NAAC accreditation
content: Of the roughly 2,000 higher education institutions operating in the State, 334 have NAAC accreditation. The State Level Quality Assurance Cell’s initiative includes training programmes on the new accreditation framework

title: Efforts are on to get clearance for Mahadayi, says Bommai
content: MPs from the region, including Jagadish Shettar, P.C. Gaddigoudar, to meet the Union Minister for Environment, Forest and Climate Change

title: In strife-torn Moreh, Myanmar children bring a sliver of hope
content: Border town in Manipur sees revival of limited trade and schooling as families cross from civil war-hit Myanmar

title: Srisailam temple authorities focus on beautification of Shikaram
content: Located 8-km from the main temple, Shikaram is a sacred spot at a height of 2,830 feet above the main sea level and is the highest peak of Srisailam, devotees throng this place for the panoramic view of the temple and river Krishna

title: Farmer on night vigil killed in attack by 16-member herd of wild elephants in Andhra Pradesh’s Chittoor district
content: Irate villagers stage a blockade on the Tirupati-Punganur Road along with the body of the victim, accusing the Forest Department of gross negligence and demanding that an action plan be evolved to put an end to the man-animal conflict in the western mandals of the district

title: Illegal surrogacy and baby-selling racket busted in Hyderabad; fertility clinic head among 10 arrested
content: Police investigation revealed that the owner of Universal Srushti Fertility Centres had been running an unauthorised surrogacy and baby-selling operation after shifting to IVF services since 1998.

title: Tamil Nadu’s Own Tax revenue increases 14.5% in Q1, FY2025-2026
content: It rises to ₹43,070.45 crore from ₹37,605.43 crore in the same period last year. SOTR constitutes 75.3% of Tamil Nadu’s total revenue receipts

title: US Says Tariff Deadline Of August 1 Is Firm, No Extensions
content: The US deadline of August 1 for imposing tariffs on its trading partners is firm and there will be no extensions, Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick said Sunday.

title: Video: Man Shouts "Going To Bomb The Plane" Mid-Air, Arrested In Scotland
content: A man has been arrested for causing a disturbance on an Easyjet flight from London Luton Airport to Glasgow. A video that has gone viral on social media shows the man shouting, "I am going to bomb the plane".

title: Small Plane Carrying 3 Crashes Off California Coast, Search Underway
content: Authorities are searching for three people who were aboard a private twin-engine plane that crashed off the central California coast.

title: Couple Finds Surrogate Baby Has No Genetic Links To Them, Doctor Among 10 Arrested In Hyderabad
content: A case of illegal surrogacy and sperm trafficking racket has been busted in Secunderabad, leading to the arrest of ten people, including a doctor - Dr Namrata - who was the manager of Universal Srushti Fertility Centre in Regimental Bazaar.

title: Weather Office Predicts Thunderstorms With Rain In Delhi Today
content: The national capital recorded a maximum temperature of 37.5 degrees Celsius on Sunday, two notches above the season's average, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) said.

title: Babbar Khalsa International Operative, 22, Arrested For Punjab Grenade Attack
content: The Special Cell of the Delhi Police has arrested a 22-year-old man linked to the banned terror group Babbar Khalsa International (BKI) and wanted in connection with a grenade attack in Punjab.

title: Tripura Allies BJP And Tipra Motha Workers Clash During Mann Ki Baat Broadcast
content: In a major political development in Tripura, members of the BJP and its key ally Tipra Motha clashed on Sunday at an area where BJP supporters claimed to have assembled to listen to Prime Minister Narendra Modi's monthly radio broadcast Mann Ki Baat.

title: Israel Begins Daily Pause In Fighting In Parts of Gaza Amid Surging Hunger
content: The Israeli military on Sunday began a limited pause in fighting in three populated areas of Gaza for 10 hours a day, part of measures including airdrops as concerns grow over surging hunger and international criticism.

title: 13-Year-Old Boy Killed For Stealing Pigeon In Punjab, 3 Charged: Police
content: A 13-year-old boy was killed allegedly by three villagers for stealing a pigeon in Punjab's Mansa district, police said on Sunday.

title: "Need To Relook At Our History": Economist As PM Offers Prayers At Iconic Cholapuram Temple
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi's visit to the Gangaikonda Cholapuram Shiva temple, has put the spotlight on the Chola empire, especially on the time of Rajendra Chola, who stood tall when northern India was under Muslim rule.

title: UP Cop's Wife Alleges Harassment By In-Laws In Video, Dies By Suicide
content: The wife of a police constable in Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow died by suicide allegedly over harassment by her in-laws.

title: 8 Dead, 30 Injured In Stampede At Haridwar's Mansa Devi Temple
content: Eight people have died and dozens of devotees suffered injuries in a stampede at the Mansa Devi temple in the holy city of Haridwar in Uttarakhand. The stampede occurred on the staircases on the temple road leading to the main temple.

title: "Why Such Big Fuss?" Poll Body On Row Over Bihar Voter Roll Revision
content: The Election Commission of India (ECI) has strongly criticised "some persons" for spreading misinformation about the special intensive revision (SIR) exercise that was carried out in Bihar to clean up the electoral rolls.

title: "Services Down The Drain": M Kharge On When He Missed Out Being Chief Minister
content: Mallikarjun Kharge, Congress chief and Gandhi family loyalist, voiced regrets on how he missed being the Chief Minister of Karnataka despite winning an election for the Congress.

title: Delhi Plans To Launch Night Market For Foodies, Will Feature Food Trucks
content: Delhi may soon get its own late-night food hub, with the government planning to launch a night market in the NDMC area, inspired by Indore's iconic 56 Dukan model.

title: 3 Killed After Tanker Explodes At Asphalt Plant In Gujarat: Police
content: Three persons were killed when a tanker exploded while being heated to empty asphalt from the vehicle at a plant near Vadodara in Gujarat on Sunday evening, police said.

title: 7-Year-Old Runs After Ball, Falls Into Open Fire Safety Tank In Assam, Dies
content: A 7-year-old boy was found dead after falling into a deep uncovered fire safety tank in a housing complex in Assam's Dibrugarh today.

title: After Trump Mediation Efforts, Thai, Cambodian Leaders Agree To Talks Over Border Dispute
content: Thai and Cambodian leaders will meet in Malaysia for talks to end hostilities, a spokesperson of the Thai prime minister's office said on Sunday.

title: He Slit Throats Of His 2 Stepbrothers While Dropping Them To School In Assam
content: A teenager in Assam has been arrested for allegedly killing his two young stepbrothers, whose bodies were found two days after they went missing on Friday. The two boys were found dead on Saturday, with their throats slit.

title: Raj Thackeray Visits Matoshree After 13 Years For Cousin Uddhav's Birthday
content: In a move that has reignited long-drawn speculation in Maharashtra politics, Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) chief Raj Thackeray on Saturday visited Matoshree, the residence of his estranged cousin and Shiv Sena (UBT) chief Uddhav Thackeray.
